TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DrmManagerClient extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The main programming interface for the DRM framework.

remarks.para: The main programming interface for the DRM framework. An application must instantiate this class to access DRM agents through the DRM framework.

Docs.summary: Processes a given and returns the rights information asynchronously.

remarks.para: Processes a given and returns the rights information asynchronously.

This is a utility method that consists of an and a method call. This utility method can be used only if the selected DRM plug-in (agent) supports this sequence of calls. Some DRM agents, such as OMA, do not support this utility method, in which case an application must invoke and separately.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Drm.DrmConvertedStatus CloseConvertSession (int convertId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Drm.DrmConvertedStatus CloseConvertSession(int32 convertId) cil managed

Docs.summary: Informs the DRM plug-in (agent) that there is no more data to convert or that an error has occurred.

remarks.para: Informs the DRM plug-in (agent) that there is no more data to convert or that an error has occurred. Upon successful conversion of the data, the DRM agent will provide an offset value indicating where the header and body signature should be added. Appending the signature is necessary to protect the integrity of the converted file.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Drm.DrmConvertedStatus ConvertData (int convertId, byte[] inputData);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Drm.DrmConvertedStatus ConvertData(int32 convertId, unsigned int8[] inputData) cil managed

Docs.param: Input data that needs to be converted.
Docs.summary: Converts the input data (content) that is part of a rights-protected file.

remarks.para: Converts the input data (content) that is part of a rights-protected file. The converted data and status is returned in a object. This method should be called each time there is a new block of data received by the application.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int OpenConvertSession (string mimeType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 OpenConvertSession(string mimeType) cil managed

Docs.param: MIME type of the input data packet.
Docs.summary: Initiates a new conversion session.

remarks.para: Initiates a new conversion session. An application must initiate a conversion session with this method each time it downloads a rights-protected file that needs to be converted.
This method applies only to forward-locking (copy protection) DRM schemes.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Release ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Release() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases resources associated with the current session of DrmManagerClient.

remarks.para:
Releases resources associated with the current session of DrmManagerClient.
It is considered good practice to call this method when the object is no longer needed in your application. After release() is called, is no longer usable since it has lost all of its required resource.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Drm.DrmManagerClientErrorCode RemoveAllRights() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all the rights information of every DRM plug-in (agent) associated with the DRM framework.

remarks.para: Removes all the rights information of every DRM plug-in (agent) associated with the DRM framework. Will be used during a master reset.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Drm.DrmManagerClientErrorCode SaveRights(class Android.Drm.DrmRights drmRights, string rightsPath, string contentPath) cil managed

Docs.param: File path where rights will be saved.
File path where content is saved.
Docs.summary: Saves rights to a specified path and associates that path with the content path.

remarks.para: Saves rights to a specified path and associates that path with the content path.
Note: For OMA or WM-DRM, rightsPath and contentPath can be null.

Docs.exception: If the call failed to save rights information at the given rightsPath.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
